body: This is simply not possible. Please run ```nvidia-smi``` and see which processes are using devices 0 and 1.

![541499651](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32585434/139816599-1a85dd12-f5bd-4b77-bc56-7784b425e72b.jpg)
![1117368157](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32585434/139816621-386452b0-d646-4a95-9dcd-fdaed29f7773.jpg)

the tow pic shows ï¼‘ card and 0 card,and  when set device_id =1  two process run of python3.6  and when set device_id=0,one process run 

my setting codes like this:
 self.sess = rt.InferenceSession(MODEL_PATH)
        #rt.SessionOptions
        self.sess.set_providers(['CUDAExecutionProvider'], provider_options=[{'device_id': 1,'gpu_mem_limit':2 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024}])
it is really wired,i test serval models set device_id=1,two process run of python3.6

We've never heard from anyone where the device id specified by the user was not honored.

* Can you verify before starting inferencing using ORT there's nothing running on the GPUs?
* The 2 processes shown in the first fig have the same PID. So, they aren't 2 separate processes.
* Are you creating 2 separate sessions each corresponding to a separate device? If so, are they created in separate Python files and invoked?
* Can you try setting the device id [this way](https://onnxruntime.ai/docs/execution-providers/CUDA-ExecutionProvider.html#python) and see if it works for you? This is to rule out any unknown bugs with the set_providers API.

import onnxruntime as ort
from PIL import Image
import numpy as np
import cv2
class AngleProcesss:
    def __init__(self,model_path,size_h = 32,size_w = 192):

             #self.providers = [('CUDAExecutionProvider', {
         #   'device_id': 0,
           # 'arena_extend_strategy': 'kNextPowerOfTwo',
          #  'gpu_mem_limit': 2 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024,
         #   'cudnn_conv_algo_search': 'EXHAUSTIVE',
        #    'do_copy_in_default_stream': True,
         #    }),'CPUExecutionProvider' ]

        self.sess = ort.InferenceSession(model_path)
        self.sess.set_providers(['CUDAExecutionProvider'],  provider_options=[{'device_id': 1,'gpu_mem_limit':2 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024}])
   
        self._size_h = size_h
        self._size_w = size_w


    def infer(self,im):
        scale = im.size[1] * 1.0 / self._size_h
        w = im.size[0] / scale
        w = int(w)
        img = im.resize((w, self._size_h), Image.BILINEAR)

        if w < self._size_w:
            imgnew = Image.new('RGB', (self._size_w, self._size_h), (255))
            imgnew.paste(img, (0, 0, w, self._size_h))
        else:
            imgnew = img.crop((0, 0, self._size_w, self._size_h))

        img = np.array(imgnew, dtype=np.float32)

        img -= 127.5
        img /= 127.5
        image = img.transpose(2, 0, 1)
        transformed_image = np.expand_dims(image, axis=0)
[angle_net.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/files/7464860/angle_net.zip)

        preds = self.sess.run(["out"], {"input": transformed_image.astype(np.float32)})

        pred = np.argmax(preds[0])

        return pred

    def infer_rbgs(self, imgs):
        nlen = len(imgs)
        res_sum = sum([self.infer(im) for im in imgs])
        return res_sum < nlen // 2

if __name__=="__main__":
    _AngleMoel = AngleProcesss('./angle_net.onnx')
    img = Image.open("./1297885964.jpg")

    for i in range(10000):
        _AngleMoel.infer(img)
@pranavsharma  can i build the latest code in master branch with cuda 11.2 or any cuda version,and get .whl files then install it by myself

> @pranavsharma can i build the latest code in master branch with cuda 11.2 or any cuda version,and get .whl files then install it by myself

yes, you can. Use --build_wheel option to build the wheel file.

I tried your code and I can't reproduce the issue. I chose device id 1 and inferencing runs on the device specified.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2732907/140021063-40bd4e26-e99b-442c-b48d-f6c1e98363d1.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2732907/140021097-03dd0907-6ce9-49f1-9492-2e89940044e9.png)
@pranavsharma  did you  try onnxruntime_gpu 1.6.0? i meet this in that veersion,i really reproduce this problem and  always  happened

Yes, just tried with 1.6.0 as well. 
```
(pranav_py8) pranav@OrtTrainingDev3:~$ cat issue_9645.py
import onnxruntime as ort
from PIL import Image
import numpy as np
import cv2
import os

class AngleProcesss:
    def __init__(self,model_path,size_h = 32,size_w = 192):
        # print("here..")
        self.sess = ort.InferenceSession(model_path)
        self.sess.set_providers(['CUDAExecutionProvider'],  provider_options=[{'device_id': 1,'gpu_mem_limit':2 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024}])

        self._size_h = size_h
        self._size_w = size_w


    def infer(self,im):
        scale = im.size[1] * 1.0 / self._size_h
        w = im.size[0] / scale
        w = int(w)
        img = im.resize((w, self._size_h), Image.BILINEAR)

        if w < self._size_w:
            imgnew = Image.new('RGB', (self._size_w, self._size_h), (255))
            imgnew.paste(img, (0, 0, w, self._size_h))
        else:
            imgnew = img.crop((0, 0, self._size_w, self._size_h))

        img = np.array(imgnew, dtype=np.float32)

        img -= 127.5
        img /= 127.5
        image = img.transpose(2, 0, 1)
        transformed_image = np.expand_dims(image, axis=0)
        # print("calling run")
        preds = self.sess.run(["out"], {"input": transformed_image.astype(np.float32)})
        pred = np.argmax(preds[0])
        # print("done with one run")
        return pred

    def infer_rbgs(self, imgs):
        nlen = len(imgs)
        res_sum = sum([self.infer(im) for im in imgs])
        return res_sum < nlen // 2

if __name__== "__main__":
    print("version: ", ort.__version__)
    print("process id: ", os.getpid())
    _AngleMoel = AngleProcesss('./angle_net.onnx')
    img = Image.open("./Sample-jpg-image-50kb.jpg")
    for i in range(10000):
        _AngleMoel.infer(img)
```

```
(pranav_py8) pranav@OrtTrainingDev3:~$ LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda-10.2/lib64/ python issue_9645.py
version:  1.6.0
process id:  13009
```
